The plugin module application side API.

Libraries
extit_pmodule (-lextit_pmodule, extit_pmodule.lib)

Headers
#include <iv/base.h>
#include <extit/base.h>
#include <extit/pmodule.h>

Usage
typedef ... extit_module_t

A module instance.

Since:
1.0
typedef extit_status_t (*extit_module_scan_callback_t)(extit_module_t * module, void * client_data)

A function that is called by extit_module_scan() or extit_module_scan_wc() for loaded modules.

Parameters:
module - The module instance.
client_data - Application defined data.
Returns:
The operation status (EXTIT_STATUS_*). If EXTIT_STATUS_OK is returned, then it is the responsibility of the callback to release the module with extit_module_release(). Any other return value will cause the module to be immediately released.
Since:
1.0
typedef bool (*extit_module_scan_fnfilter_t)(const char * basename, size_t length, void * client_data)

A function that is called by extit_module_scan() for each potential file to check if it is acceptable.

Parameters:
basename - The filename without any directory.
length - The length of the filename.
client_data - Application defined data.
Returns:
true, if the filename is acceptable, or false otherwise.
Since:
1.0
typedef bool (*extit_module_scan_fnfilter_wc_t)(const wchar_t * basename, size_t length, void * client_data)

A function that is called by extit_module_scan_wc() for each potential file to check if it is acceptable. This function is only available on platforms that support wide character filenames.

Parameters:
basename - The filename without any directory.
length - The length of the filename (in characters).
client_data - Application defined data.
Returns:
true, if the filename is acceptable, or false otherwise.
Since:
1.0
extit_module_t *
extit_module_bind(const extit_container_t * container, const void * descriptor, unsigned int flags)

Create a module from a plugin module descriptor. This should be released with extit_module_release().

Parameters:
container - The container interface.
descriptor - The descriptor address.
flags - The module flags (EXTIT_FLAG_*).
Returns:
A module pointer, or NULL if the bind failed.
Since:
1.0
extit_plugin_t *
extit_module_create_plugin(extit_module_t * module)

Create a plugin instance for a module. The plugin should be freed with extit_plugin_destroy().

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
Returns:
A plugin pointer, or NULL if the create failed.
Since:
1.0

extit_module_get_effective_abi_version(extit_module_t * module)

Get the plugin system ABI version level supported by both the container and the plugin module.

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
Returns:
The plugin system ABI version being used for this module.

extit_module_get_function(extit_module_t * module, const char * name)

Resolve a function symbol in a plugin module.

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
name - The symbol name.
Returns:
A function pointer, or NULL if the symbol wasn't found.

Parameters:

Returns:
The plugin identifier.
Since:
1.0
uint32_t
extit_module_get_id_version(extit_module_t * module)

Get the identifier relative version of the plugin module. The format is implementation defined, but must return larger values for higher versions and smaller values for lower versions.

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
Returns:
The plugin version relative to the identifier.
Since:
1.0

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
Returns:
The plugin name.
Since:
1.0

Resolve a symbol address in a plugin module.

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
name - The symbol name.
Returns:
An address pointer, or NULL if the symbol wasn't found.
Since:
1.0
const char *
extit_module_get_version(extit_module_t * module)

Get the version of the plugin module.

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
Returns:
The plugin version (in text format).
Since:

extit_module_t *
extit_module_load(const extit_container_t * container, const char * path, unsigned int flags)

Create a module from a loadable library file. This should be released with extit_module_release().

Parameters:
container - The container interface.
path - The loadable library file path.
flags - The module flags (EXTIT_FLAG_*).
Returns:
A module pointer, or NULL if the load failed.
Since:
1.0
extit_module_t *
extit_module_load_wc(const extit_container_t * container, const wchar_t * path, unsigned int flags)

Create a module from a loadable library file. This function is only available on platforms that support wide character filenames. This should be released with extit_module_release().

Parameters:
container - The container interface.
path - The loadable library file path.
flags - The module flags (EXTIT_FLAG_*).
Returns:
A module pointer, or NULL if the load failed.
Since:
1.0
extit_status_t
extit_module_release(extit_module_t * module)

Release a plugin module. This fail if plugins instances still exist for the module.

Parameters:
module - The plugin module.
Returns:
The operation status (EXTIT_STATUS_*).
Since:
1.0
extit_status_t
extit_module_scan(const extit_container_t * container, const char * directory, extit_module_scan_callback_t callback, const void * callback_client_data, extit_module_scan_fnfilter_t fnfilter, const void * fnfilter_client_data, unsigned int flags)

Scan a directory for plugin modules. fnfilter will be called for each normal file, which should return true, if the filename is acceptable, or false otherwise. For each valid module found and loaded, callback will be called with it. Any module that was passed to callback, which returned EXTIT_STATUS_OK, must be released with extit_module_release() to prevent memory and/or resource leaks, even if the callback does not use the module.

Parameters:
container - The container interface.
directory - The directory to scan.
callback - The callback function.
callback_client_data - Additional data to pass to callback.
fnfilter - The filename filter callback function.
fnfilter_client_data - Additional data to pass to fnfilter.
flags - The module flags (EXTIT_FLAG_*).
Returns:
The operation status (EXTIT_STATUS_*).
Since:
1.0
extit_status_t
extit_module_scan_wc(const extit_container_t * container, const wchar_t * directory, extit_module_scan_callback_t callback, const void * callback_client_data, extit_module_scan_fnfilter_wc_t fnfilter, const void * fnfilter_client_data, unsigned int flags)

Scan a directory for plugin modules. fnfilter will be called for each normal file, which should return true, if the filename is acceptable, or false otherwise. For each valid module found and loaded, callback will be called with it. Any module that was passed to callback, which returned EXTIT_STATUS_OK, must be released with extit_module_release() to prevent memory and/or resource leaks, even if the callback does not use the module. This function is only available on platforms that support wide character filenames.

Parameters:
container - The container interface.
directory - The directory to scan.
callback - The callback function.
callback_client_data - Additional data to pass to callback.
fnfilter - The filename filter callback function.
fnfilter_client_data - Additional data to pass to fnfilter.
flags - The module flags (EXTIT_FLAG_*).
Returns:
The operation status (EXTIT_STATUS_*).
Since:
1.0
bool
extit_module_scan_fnfilter_default(const char * libname, size_t length, void * client_data)

A standard filename filter that accepts filenames with the platform default shared library extension (e.g. .dll on Windows, .so on Unix/Linux/BSD, .dylib on macOS). Checks are case-insensitive on Windows/macOS and case-sensitive for other platforms. The client_data value is ignored by this function.

Parameters:
libname - The name of the library file.
length - The length of the library filename.
client_data - Application defined data.
Returns:
true to accept the file, or false to reject it.
Since:
1.0
bool
extit_module_scan_fnfilter_wc_default(const wchar_t * libname, size_t length, void * client_data)

A standard filename filter that accepts filenames with the platform default shared library extension (e.g. .dll on Windows, .so on Unix/Linux/BSD, .dylib on macOS). Checks are case-insensitive on Windows/macOS and case-sensitive for other platforms. The client_data value is ignored by this function. This function is only available on platforms that support wide character filenames.

Parameters:
libname - The name of the library file.
length - The length of the library filename (in characters).
client_data - Application defined data.
Returns:
true to accept the file, or false to reject it.
Since:
1.0

void *
extit_plugin_get_context(extit_plugin_t * plugin)

Returns:
The context value.

Returns:

extit_plugin_query_interface(extit_plugin_t * plugin, const char * iid, iv_version_t base_version)

Parameters:

Returns:
